journey_steps.description: The customer becomes aware of the airline service through various channels such as advertisements, word of mouth, online reviews, or travel agencies.
The customer researches the airline, gathering information about its routes, flight schedules, pricing, in-flight services, and overall reputation.
The customer compares the airline's fares and services with those of other airlines.
The customer makes a decision based on their research and comparison, weighing factors like price, flight times, amenities, and customer reviews.
The customer books a flight, choosing their desired dates, routes, and cabin class.
The customer experiences the airline's pre-flight services, such as online check-in, seat selection, and customer support.
The customer interacts with the airline at the airport, which includes boarding pass issuance, baggage drop-off, security checks, and boarding.
The customer experiences the airline's in-flight services, including seating, meal options, in-flight entertainment, and the cabin crew's service quality.
After the flight, the customer goes through immigration and customs, baggage claim, and potentially connects to other flights if applicable.
Post-trip interaction with the airline may occur, including dealing with issues like lost luggage, flight delays, cancellations, or refunds.
